thread.title: Attendance Builds for Southwest Data Center Summit; Announcing Opening Night Reception at IO Phoenix
thread.title_full: Attendance Builds for Southwest Data Center Summit; Announcing Opening Night Reception at IO Phoenix

author: admin
title: Attendance Builds for Southwest Data Center Summit; Announcing Opening Night Reception at IO Phoenix
text:
Southwest Data Center Summit 
PHOENIX, Sep. 1, 2015 /PRNewswire-iReach/ -- Attendance continues to build for The Fourth Annual Southwest Data Center Summit, the premier industry gathering for high-level market intelligence and networking. Expert speakers who represent the most active and innovative data center developers, investors, capital sources, brokers, consultants and technology firms from Phoenix, Las Vegas, Los Angeles and San Diego will attend and participate. The summit's 50+ speakers will discuss the many trends, patterns, opportunities and challenges, including: 
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150901/262830 
How are industry executives approaching challenges in 2015, including customization of data centers? What steps are industry leaders taking to remain competitive? Analysis of opportunities tied to IoE (Internet on Everything): How is the increased demand from mobile devices and all internet enabled devices (iWatch, etc.) and (kitchen/house) appliances at home changing the game? How are industry leaders approaching both data security (data traversing the networking) and physical data center security? Have cloud/IaaS deployments in the U.S. (ie colo needs of the cloud platform providers) started to taper and become less of a demand driver? M&A - how do Phoenix/Southwest assets fit into potential industry consolidation? Why develop or invest in Southwest markets? How strong are the Southwest regional data center markets and what are the customers demands? How is the cloud impacting the business? How do investors view resiliency? How is the multi-tiered model design playing out? What types of verticals are utilizing data center services? What are this region's competitive markets? 
** Special Group Discount: Register Two or More Attendees and Save 33% ** 
** 2015 Southwest Data Center Summit Schedule ** 
November 9; 5:30pm-8:00pm: Opening Night Reception & Data Center Tour at IO Phoenix | IO Phoenix provides you with the capabilities to transform your business with a standardized and secure modular data center infrastructure, managed by IO's pre-integrated DCIM software. IO Phoenix provides unprecedented flexibility, security and energy efficiency. 
November 10; 2015, 7:00am-4:00pm: Full-Day Conference at Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel: Panel sessions to focus on state of the market, new development/site selection, investment, financing, connectivity innovations. 
"The National Data Center Summit Series delivers high quality content and meaningful networking in major U.S. cities and regions. The conference is a valuable platform to hear from industry leaders and develop new relationships. It is a high-quality event." -- Todd Bateman, North American Agency Practice Leader - Data Center Solutions, CBRE 
View detailed agenda > http://cre-events.com/southwestdc2015/agenda/ 
View registration information > https://www.regonline.com/Register/Checkin.aspx?EventID=1735930 
Confirmed Speakers: -- Victor Goodman, CEO, Corporate Colocation, Inc. -- Jim Gromberg, Metro Area Business Development Representative, Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development -- Scott Huguenin, Solutions Director - SOUTHWEST, Digital Realty -- Rashad Kawmy, Vice President - Leveraged Finance, CapitalSource -- Mark Kidd, SVP & GM, Data Centers, Iron Mountain -- Miles Loo, Jr., Executive Director - Valuation & Advisory, Cushman & Wakefield -- James Lowey, Vice President - Technology, Translational Genomics Research Institute (TGen) -- Ian McClarty, President, PhoenixNAP -- Ryan Oro, Vice President, General Management, Coresite -- Chris Orlando, Co-Founder & CSMO, ScaleMatrix -- Michael Ortiz, Associate Vice President, Technology Solutions Group | West Region, Colliers International -- John Regan, Vice President, Data Center Division, Carter Validus Advisors -- Josh Snowhorn, Vice President & GM of Interconnection, CyrusOne -- Mike Vignato, Executive Vice President, The ANTARA Group -- Neil Walker, Director of Procurement, Limelight Networks -- Scott Youngs, CIO, Key Information Systems, Inc. 
View detailed agenda > http://cre-events.com/southwestdc2015/agenda/ 
View registration information > https://www.regonline.com/Register/Checkin.aspx?EventID=1735930 
Attending Firms: 375 executives from 175 firms, including all of the region's active developers, investors, capital sources, brokers and consultancy firms, have made plans to attend, as of October 29; 400+ are expected: -- Air Enterprises -- API Systems Group -- CapitalSource -- CapRate Events -- Carter Validus Advisors -- ComRent -- Coresite -- Corporate Colocation, Inc. -- Cushman & Wakefield -- CyrusOne -- DC Group -- DEERNS -- Digital Realty -- Geist Global -- Hyde Group -- Iron Mountain -- JLL -- Key Information Systems, Inc. -- Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development -- PhoenixNAP -- Ramtek Mission Criticl Solutions -- Raritan, Inc. -- ScaleMatrix -- Schneider Electric -- SRP -- Sunbelt Controls -- The ANTARA Group -- Translational Genomics Research Institute (TGen)
